instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-4924: What is 820-4924? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no KB and TPAD
threads.message:
liquid damaged machine, very little areas we're corroded a bit near the kb connector and a tiny bit near the trackpad connector and on the kb backlight.

The trackpad force touch actuates but no click is registered and no movement with keyboard only the power button and backlight works.

<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S4_TPAD</SIGNAL> measures 3.3v, no signs of corrosion near <CHIP>U4830</CHIP> & <CHIP>U4820</CHIP>.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no KB and TPAD
[SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no KB and TPAD
threads.message: i dont have another trackpad but i tried unplugging it and still no keyboard, also tried unplugging kb and still no tp

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no KB and TPAD
threads.message: Trackpad needs to be connected and working, otherwise keyboard will not work...

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no KB and TPAD
threads.message:
ow i did not know that, i'll order in a new trackpad and cable. Thank you

Is that the same for all retinas?

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no KB and TPAD
[SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no KB and TPAD
threads.message:
So its just the force touch ones that need the touchpad for the keyboard to work?

I'll check those corroded vias near the tpad connector

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no KB and TPAD
threads.message: Trackpad and cable first, only then mess with the board.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no KB and TPAD
[SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no KB and TPAD
threads.message:
Tried with another tpad and cable, forgot i had a extra housing. Same problem.

<SIGNAL>TPAD_SPI_INT_L</SIGNAL> via looked dodgey and sure enough it wasnt making a connection. Patched it up and all working now.

Thanks for all your input, would have probably taken me a while to figure out tpad was needed for kb

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no KB and TPAD
threads.message:
Just noticed Left shift control and alt are not working. Tested with new keyboard same problem. 

Checked for gunk in connector and continuity from the connector to <CHIP>U4850</CHIP> all is good, any ideas?

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no KB and TPAD
threads.message: the connector was not getting pp3v42 ran a wire and now all is good. Thanks again
